page.title: 05Cornish customs
page.content: Although making clotted cream is a dying tradition now,it is still made in cornish households.There are two traditional drinks,which are Cider made from apples,and Mead made from honey.Pasties are still the traditional cornish savory food and are made, and sold locally.Annually in Mevagissey there is a feast week where there are carnivals,regattas and fetes and in Pentewan there is a festival called The Pentewan Regatta.Both date back a long way,in churches on Rogation Sunday there is an old ceremony called the Blessing of the Waters.It is traditional to build Cornish hedgerows from slate.The gaps are filled with earth,not cement.The top of the walls are often built to give a herring-bone effect.Eventually the slate becomes covered over with ivy,grass,brambles,and other plants.
